intro: Monotes caloneurus, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
